security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with no security concerns. Provides utilities for skill creation, validation, and packaging with proper input validation and safe file operations.

content.user_title: Skill Creator - Build Custom AI Agent Capabilities
content.value_statement: A comprehensive framework for creating, validating, and packaging custom AI agent skills with specialized workflows, scripts, references, and assets.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skills from templates with proper structure
Validate skill structure and frontmatter according to specifications
Guide progressive disclosure patterns for efficient context management
Support bundled resources: scripts, references, and assets
Provide design patterns for workflows and output formatting
Generate YAML frontmatter and markdown templates automatically
limitations: Requires manual implementation of skill-specific logic and resources
Validation is basic and doesn't catch all semantic issues
No automated testing framework for created skills
Users must understand skill design principles for effective results

use_cases.title: Build Tool Integrations

use_cases.title: Template-Based Content Generation

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill from Scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill for [domain/task]. Users will ask things like '[example query 1]' and '[example query 2]'. Help me build this skill.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a completely new skill with user requirements

prompt_templates.title: Improve Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a skill at [path]. It struggles with [specific issue]. Help me improve it by [updating SKILL.md / adding references / creating scripts].
prompt_templates.scenario: Iterating on a skill based on real usage feedback

prompt_templates.title: Package Skill for Distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill at [path] is ready. Validate and package it into a .skill file.
prompt_templates.scenario: Final packaging step after development is complete

prompt_templates.title: Convert Workflow to Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I repeatedly do [workflow description]. Help me create a skill so Claude can handle this automatically.

output_examples.input: Create a skill for PDF form filling
output_examples.output: Initialized skill directory with SKILL.md template, created scripts/fill_form.py for deterministic field population, added references/api_reference.md for PDF library documentation, and included assets/sample_form.pdf for testing.
Validated frontmatter, checked naming conventions, verified all references exist, packaged into my-analytics-skill.skill (zip format) with all scripts, references, and assets preserved.

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines by using progressive disclosure with reference files
Write comprehensive descriptions in frontmatter - they're the primary triggering mechanism
Include 'when to use' information in the description field, not the body
Use scripts for fragile, deterministic operations that would be rewritten repeatedly
Store detailed documentation in references/ to keep SKILL.md lean
Test scripts by actually running them before packaging
Match specificity to task fragility: high freedom for text instructions, low freedom for critical sequences
Challenge every piece of content: 'Does Claude really need this explanation?'
Avoid duplication between SKILL.md and reference files
anti_patterns: Creating README.md, CHANGELOG.md, or other auxiliary documentation files
Putting 'when to use' guidance in the skill body instead of frontmatter description
Deeply nested references (keep one level deep from SKILL.md)
Loading all reference content into SKILL.md instead of using progressive disclosure
Verbose explanations when concise examples would suffice
Exceeding 64 characters for skill name or 1024 for description

faq.question: When should I use scripts vs references vs assets?
faq.answer: Use scripts/ for executable code that's repeatedly rewritten or needs deterministic reliability. Use references/ for documentation Claude should read to inform decisions (schemas, APIs, policies). Use assets/ for files that go into the output (templates, images, boilerplate).

faq.question: How do I know if my skill will trigger correctly?
faq.answer: The frontmatter description is the primary trigger. Include both what the skill does AND specific scenarios/contexts when it should be used. Be comprehensive - the body only loads after triggering.

faq.question: What's the maximum size for SKILL.md?
faq.answer: Keep under 500 lines to minimize context bloat. Use progressive disclosure by splitting detailed content into reference files and linking them from SKILL.md with clear guidance on when to read them.

faq.question: Can I add custom fields to the frontmatter?
faq.answer: No. Only name, description, license, allowed-tools, and metadata are allowed. The validator will reject unexpected keys.

faq.question: How do I update an existing skill?
faq.answer: Edit the SKILL.md or bundled resources directly, test changes, then re-run package_skill.py to create an updated .skill file.

permissions: File system read/write for skill directory and packaging
